entries.title: Brazil’s Authorities Race to Identify Organizers of Brasília Riot
entries.description: With more than 500 people arrested after supporters of Jair Bolsonaro ransacked Brazil’s seats of government, the authorities began to search for those who funded and aided the rioters.

entries.title: Brazil’s Authorities Race to Identify Organizers of Capitol Riot
entries.description: With more than 500 people arrested after supporters of Jair Bolsonaro ransacked Brazil’s seats of government, the authorities began to search for those who funded and aided the rioters.

entries.title: Prince Harry Skewers Palace Culture With Nicknames and a Dose of Rancor
entries.description: Along with the juicy tidbits Prince Harry offers up in his new memoir, there is also a revealing look at how the royal family, and its staff, operate behind closed doors.

entries.title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Shanghai’s Devastating Outbreak
entries.description: Also, the eight warmest years on record and a fragile political alliance in the Philippines.

entries.title: Vatican Pledges to Look Into Emanuela Orlandi  Disappearance
entries.description: Vatican officials said they would reopen a cold case that has gripped Italians, spawned countless theories and been the subject of a Netflix documentary series.

entries.title: Russia Reports 2022 Deficit of $47 Billion
entries.description: The budget gap reached 3.3 trillion rubles, or 2.3 percent of the size of the Russian economy, according to the country’s finance minister.

entries.title: More than 200 Russian doctors petition Putin to give medical care to Navalny.
entries.description: The letter, signed by doctors with their full names, was a rare example of public criticism of the Kremlin in post-invasion Russia.

entries.title: Britain Is Considering Sending Tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: The British Challenger II could become the first Western-made main battle tank to be provided to Ukraine since Russia invaded almost a year ago.

entries.title: French Government Unveils Plan to Raise Retirement Age to 64
entries.description: President Emmanuel Macron is focusing on cutting costs in France’s pension system, but labor unions, which fiercely oppose the measure, have promised a showdown.

entries.title: Death Toll in Peru Rises to 46 Amid Extraordinary Violence
entries.description: “What happened yesterday was really a massacre,” said one human rights activist.

entries.title: How Finland Is Teaching a Generation to Spot Misinformation
entries.description: The Nordic country is testing new ways to teach students about propaganda. Here’s what other countries can learn from its success.

entries.title: President Biden Visits Mexico to Meet North American Leaders
entries.description: Economic cooperation, drug trafficking, migration and climate change are key topics for President Biden’s summit with Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada and President Andrés Manuel López Obrador of Mexico.

entries.title: Jill Biden Focuses Empowerment of Women and Girls During Mexico Trip
entries.description: Stressing the importance of economic opportunity, the first lady said empowered women are “the heart of a strong democracy.”

entries.title: Robert Moller Dies at 85; Mediated Between U.N. Envoys and the City
entries.description: As the U.S. liaison to some 50,000 United Nations diplomats and staff, he sought to resolve disputes on issues ranging from fugitives hiding in U.N. missions to diplomats’ unpaid parking tickets.

entries.title: UK Bookstores React to Prince Harry’s Memoir
entries.description: The book, “Spare,” was released on Tuesday. Some booksellers said it had generated a huge number of preorders.

entries.title: ‘Spare,’ by Prince Harry: Book Review
entries.description: At once emotional and embittered, the royal memoir is mired in a paradox: drawing endless attention in an effort to renounce fame.

entries.title: With the Return of Netanyahu in Israel, His Family Is Back, Too
entries.description: Many Israelis fear that with Benjamin Netanyahu’s return to power at the head of Israel’s most right-wing government, his family members will play an outsize role in his decision making.

entries.title: A Paris Cabaret Makes Way for ‘Cabaret’
entries.description: The 1966 American musical has opened at a venue that for decades hosted one of the city’s most famous revue troupes.

entries.title: Prompted by Russian Aggression, EU and NATO Vow New Cooperation
entries.description: A joint declaration on European security, painfully negotiated, underscores that NATO is “the foundation of collective defense.”

entries.title: Greece Opens Espionage Trial of Aid Workers Who Helped Migrants
entries.description: Sara Mardini, a Syrian refugee turned activist, is among 24 people facing charges. Amnesty International has called the case “farcical.”

entries.title: Brazil and Jan. 6
entries.description: How Brazil’s riots compare to the Jan. 6 attack.

entries.title: Wagner Group Shapes Russia’s Battle for a City in Eastern Ukraine
entries.description: The fight for the small city of Soledar has intensified as the private military group seeks to boost its standing in Russia.

entries.title: In the Philippines, Marcos and Duterte’s Alliance Revives Old Worries
entries.description: The two scions from notorious family dynasties clinched landslide election victories in 2022, but their power balance remains fragile.

entries.title: What Does It Mean to Provide ‘Security Guarantees’ to Ukraine?
entries.description: A postwar Ukraine will want to ensure that Russia does not attack again. But is there anything short of full NATO membership that will satisfy Kyiv and deter Moscow?

entries.title: U.S. Carbon Emissions Grew in 2022, Even As Renewables Surpassed Coal
entries.description: Emissions ticked up 1.3 percent last year as they continued to rebound from early pandemic lows.

entries.title: This Is What Shanghai’s Covid Outbreak Looks Like
entries.description: The Chinese city is being gripped by a massive Covid wave, leading to a surge in hospitalizations and crowded funeral homes.

entries.title: AI Is Becoming More Conversant. But Will It Get More Honest?
entries.description: At a new website called Character.AI, you can chat with a reasonable facsimile of almost anyone, live or dead, real or (especially) imagined.

entries.title: Your Tuesday Briefing
entries.description: The armies of Russia and Ukraine clash in Bakhmut.

entries.title: In Mexico, Biden Looks for Help With Migrants and Stronger Partnership
entries.description: The migration tide loomed large at the president’s summit meeting with the leaders of Mexico and Canada. All three want to steer away from the rancor of the Trump years.

entries.title: What Drove the Brazil Riots? Mass Delusion and Conspiracy Theories
entries.description: Sunday’s riot laid bare a daunting threat to Brazilian democracy: Unlike past putsch attempts in Latin America, this one was driven by deeply rooted conspiracy theories.
